artist: Suzuki Harunobu; Author: Komatsuya Hyakki; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
life_date: Suzuki Harunobu, Japanese, 1725–1770; Komatsuya Hyakki, Author, Japanese, 1720–1793; Nishimuraya Yohachi, Publisher, Japanese
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon 風流艶色真似ゑもん)
text: Mane'emon enjoys a tobacco pipe beneath a tree while a samurai wearing a mask takes a young girl by surprise in a rice field. Her parents mistake the masked creature to be associated with Inari, the god of rice, and rather than save her from the assault they reverently pray to the deity.
title: Peasant Love, No. 6 from the book Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon), vol. 1
